formattedAddress: 36 E 4th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 36 E 4th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Small Italian kitchen with a pasta-centric menu & varied wines in warm environs with a fireplace.

originalText.text: I celebrated my birthday this past weekend at Misirizzi with a large group of friends. The owner Alessandro was very accommodating to my needs and made sure my night went perfectly. The food was great and so were the drinks. The bartender and waitstaff were also on the ball with everything we asked for. I suggest starting with the polpettine (meatballs), carciofi (crispy artichoke) and burrata which were all excellent. For dinner we ordered the malfaldine, linguine, tagliatelle bolognese, cappelletti zucca and branzino which were all excellent as well. For dessert we ordered several orders of the tiramisu which were amazing, the chocolate cake and of course we had to try the DIY cannolis which made a fun addition to the night. Overall, Misirizzi is a nice, cozy, Italian spot, with friendly accommodating staff and good food which I would recommend having any future events there.

originalText.text: We did private dining here and everything was perfect. The staff was amazing and the food and wine were top notch! Would definitely recommend anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced private dining experience to give this a try!

text.text: We did private dining here and everything was perfect. The staff was amazing and the food and wine were top notch! Would definitely recommend anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced private dining experience to give this a try!

originalText.text:
Food was great all around. Our table of 5 shared the burrato and zucchini parm. Both were amazing. My friend and I shared the lasagna and mafaldine which was perfect because they were too very different dishes we wanted to try. The chocolate cake was just okay in my opinion.

We were sat in the downstairs cellar which was a dimly lit room with a long table. Docking a star due to the atmosphere - the music would play loudly for 5 min then it would be dead silent for 30 min, and this happened the whole meal

originalText.text:
Cute little spot with great food, the cocktails and dessert should not be missed.

The portions are not very big so if you're in the mood to order a lot or with a group of people will definitely recommend so you can try a lot of new things.

The friend artichoke is a must try! The lasagna is great too

text.text:

The friend artichoke is a must try! The lasagna is great too

originalText.text: Misirizzi, visually, is a very appealing restaurant. Nice interior and decor, good lighting and candles set a lovely mood. That’s the good news. The bad news is that everything after that was downhill. Firstly, I should have known that something was amiss when I walked in and found myself to be the only diner in the restaurant at 8 PM on  a midweek evening. That’s not a good sign. I was served some really mediocre, tiny baguette pieces to munch on. I ordered the endive salad with pears and Gorgonzola to start. The presentation was a major turn off. Endive  is  a chicory that should be highlighted in the salad, and has a bitter taste that makes it unusual. Here it was chopped like coleslaw, and mixed with very thinly sliced pear pieces and very dry blue cheese. This was certainly not a silky, luxurious Gorgonzola. It was a horrible start. Then, I ordered the shell steak for my main course. It was overcooked and dry, and again served in a visually unappealing fashion,  with a small paper napkin on the plate, and the broccoli and roast potatoes mixed together. No imagination or flair whatsoever in this presentation. I was so disappointed I decided to forgo coffee and dessert . I was hoping to love this place, but Misirizzi can be summed up perfectly in one word - AVOID!
